TL;DR A llove letter to horror and everything creepy, and a very fun game at its core, somewhat marred by a toxic community and flawed balancing. Play with a positive attitude and you'll have fun, play without it and you'll be stressed and angry.

I'll start off by saying this game is far from perfect. There's a lot of flaws, but there's also a lot to love. The game is very simple, but it does it well and manages to make a seemingly boring gameplay loop into a fun experience, for the most part. 

Pros:
- The game is basically a love letter to the horror genre. Besides Jason Voorhees and a few others, Dead by Daylight has the big "slasher movie" antagonists we all know and love. Michael Myers, Leatherface, Freddy Krueger, etc.. The original killers are also great, in my opinion, and are all worthy additions to the genre.
- The gameplay loop, although it seems boring and too simple on paper, is actually very satisfying and can result in a lot of fun if your doing well. The game revolves around "the trial". 4 survivors are dropped into a map, and 1 killer has to hunt them down before they can repair a series of generators to power gates they use to escape. There's no other game modes, so one would think this would get boring very fast, but it manages to hold its own surprisingly well.
- I have a lot of fun with friends in this game. While it can get frustrating (especially if you die early and can't start another match without leaving your friends) overall we all have a blast.
- Constant progression. There's always a survivor or killer to level up, thanks to a prestige system and frequent updates adding new characters. You'll never feel like you have nothing to do.

Cons:
- Utterly god awful community. I'm a stickler for good community so this is a big one. The game's community is unfortunately very toxic, which is disappointing on its own, but the toxicity also bleeds through into the gameplay as well. Toxic survivors can make playing killer very frustrating (although satisfying, if you do end up killing them) and vice versa. It's never fun being hooked and then face camped, which basically guarantees your death.
- Balancing issues. There is definitely a clear meta in this game, especially once you start getting into higher ranks. Some characters are just pointless to play, since their basic abilities are so flawed that you'd have to be god-tier to be succesful using them against competent players. This is more apparent on the killer side of the game, since survivors don't have abilities like they do, which makes them more flexible.
- Stressful gameplay. Like I said earlier, the game is fun, especially with friends...if you're doing well. If you're not, it's awfully frustrating. This is one of those games where your mindset can make or break it. Go in with a positive and healthy mindset and you'll be fine. If you're prone to getting angry at games and overly stressed while playing them, do not play this game.

Interesting game concept but VERY POOR execution.
this pile of garbage game has good times and bad but the bad outnumber them by an insane margin...
Way to easy for Survivors. Way to hard for Killers. THE ONLY time you can expect to win in this game is when you are up against a completely new player or someone who is legitimately mentally handicapped if you expect to win against players of your own level this game got it covered for you to make it unfair and turning it in the survivors favor.

Cons:
First of all Peer to Peer in a competitive multiplayer game in this day and age? REALLY?? developers seems to be immune to information and dont realize what happend to For Honor....

Laggy MM simply because of Peer to Peer you can get matched with ppl from ALL over the world which in this case is horribly bad. (for those who dont know what the Peer to Peer system is i recommend you google it)
its not a system we gamers should have to endure IN ANY game let alone in a competetive one.

Unbalanced matchmaking and get matched with ppl who are leagues ahead of you both in experience and perks...
perks.... yes perks this sh*t show i have no idea of where to start...
Unbalanced fu*king perks,the more you play the more perks and perk slots you unlock that might sound good and yes it kinda is except when you are the one matched with a completely decked out killer or in my case are a new player with absolutely nothing so expect a fun time, and by fun i mean you are gonna get killed the first 30 seconds of the game for many games to come.

so all in all its a really sh*tty game where the dev:s smoked some illegal sh*t when they came up with this idea
what i cant understand is how ppl can praise this game (youtubers/twitch streamers) and how it can be so popular is beyond me.

the devs probably dont care for their game any more, but i know they can make it great if they tried
if they made it like dota for instance where ALL charcters have a set amount of perks form the start it would be alot more easy to balance.

would i Recommend this game? Well thats hard its a nice game AND HAS potential but not in its current state no
i really wished steam wouldnt have just a 2 hour playtime for refund it needs to be extended otherwise we get things like this consumers shouldnt pay for devs shiity decisions.
I like it ,Good job who made this game.

#NerfFreddy

PREFACE:
I bought this game prior to a lot of patches buffing killers were implemented. The game was really fun at first. There's a definite learning curve, but once I figured out how the game worked it quickly became one of my most played games. As of now (October 4th, 2018), I can only handle a few games at a time before the game becomes too unplayable. 

BACKGROUND:
When the game FIRST came out, there were things such as "instant blinds" as well as "vacuum pallets" that made the game SUPER lame for killers. Naturally, killer mains cried to the developers. This resulted in following patches up to this date (October 4th, 2018) being solely focused on nerfing survivor perks and buffing those of killers. Items such as the "odd bulb" which were used for the "instant blind" were nerfed to the point where an item add-on literally half its value works better (they haven't updated the item description, nor balanced the rest of the add-ons accordingly). "Vacuum pallets" were removed from the game (albiet, rightfully so, they were pretty broken). Perks focused on survivability and looping ability were nerfed (ie: exhaustion debuff nerfs). 

At the same time, killers are being buffed endlessly. Bloodlust timer was reduced so they can catch up to survivors faster. Killers get new perks that give them the ability to one hit every single survivor if you cleanse the wrong totem. Overall performance such as lunge range was improved on certain killers. 

Did I mention killers are the ones who host the game? What does that mean? You guessed it! Lag switchers! 
Don't 360 or loop any killer too hard at high rank or they'll break out the lag switch and you'll be on the hook before you even know what happened. I don't know if they actually get banned or not, but at the rate I've encountered them, it doesn't seem like it. 

How could I forget survivor hitboxes too?! The killer's weapon doesn't even have to physically touch your character model to damage you. It's the sheer force of the shockwave behind the killer's swing that travels through the air and damages survivors. (Survivor hitboxes are significantly larger than actual character model.)


DEVELOPER SOLUTIONS:
1) MORE COSMETICS (gotta get that $$$)
2) MORE DLC (gotta get that $$$)
3) MORE PERKS BUFFING KILLERS (because they DEFINITELY need ANOTHER exposure perk, aka: instant down)
4) MORE NERFS TO SURVIVORS (because survivors are still too toxic, says lag-switching killer mains hehe xd) 

tl;dr:
1) Killers buffed endlessly + survivors nerfed endlessly
2) Devs focusing on making money instead of getting dedicated servers or actually balancing the game. 
3) Would purchase if you're interested in being a killer main. I'm sure you can get a lag-switch pretty easily as well!
4) Would not purchase if you're interesting in being a survivor main and just getting into the game. It's going to be pretty tilting. 

"We've done a pretty good job so far!" - dbd devs as they rake in microtransaction $$$

Dead by Daylight.
A game that is fun to play, yet it comes with severe dowsides which is the reason this review is negative.

Aside from the gameplay matchmaking etc. I want to focus on some fundamental things.
The game has a list of several bugs and with each update one can expect more gamebreaking bugs. 
That never really changed since the game is out + if you look at the number of DLCs you know where this goes.

What makes this game unplayable for me is:
This game takes your desktop resolution and only scales with that. You cannot really impact this. You can try config changes and goof around until you get it where you want it but that is no proper fix as it depends on your configuration.

If you have Ultrawidescreen forget it. 
You cannot even set the aspect ratio which causes the game to cut your game up with the biggest "cinematic" black bars you will ever see because a higher FOV would be unfair...
You cannot set the resolution. This issue makes the game literally unplayable. I have a 5760x1080 setup.  
The point where I got it running was in a always resizing window which got onto my nerves.

This is a KNOWN issue since this game launched on Steam (mind you I was posting about it back then). 
I ask you. Do you want to support a game with such a fundamental flaw that never got fixed? 
Please vote with your wallet.

This game is worth nothing unless they start fixing this shit. THEY HAD YEARS.
Such a simple thing. They could not even get that right by now. Don't expect your issues to get ever fixed. 
2022: Still no fix

I was looking forward to playing an online match. Had bad frames, sure, but still looked forward to playing it, especially after going through the tutorials - barely getting through the laggy skill-checks. Prepared to head into an online match, but the game froze for hours on end, refusing to close while looping through the loading sequence. No matter what I did, it remained open, to the point I had to force-restart. Tried to refund it later that day, but it seems that I can't refund a game that I have over 2h of playtime in, all because of the crap that it pulled.

If you have a good computer, give it a try, and hope you don't get a big middle-finger. I'll remain tilted in my little corner.
